name: Azal Restaurant & Hall
address: 711 Morris Park Ave, Bronx, NY 10462, USA

reviews.text: Azal offers a reliable and enjoyable Middle Eastern dining experience, though it doesn't quite rise to the level of truly memorable. Located in a bustling strip mall, the restaurant's unpretentious exterior gives way to a pleasant, moderately-decorated interior. It's a comfortable spot for a weeknight dinner, and while it lacks some of the vibrant atmosphere of other spots, the casual and clean setting is perfectly functional.
Good people

In all fairness, I appreciate effort and good manners especially in the world we live in today as this is very hard to come by. The servers, I wish I asked their names, were VERY polite and patient with us. I went there with 2 of my sisters and we were very chatty and struggled to get to the menu lol. They did not make us feel rushed in any way. The presentation of the food was very nice. I give 5 stars for this because intention is very valuable.

However â˜ğŸ¼ please address cleanliness of walls by the booths. My sisters and I joked in regards to not looking and stay focused on eachother and food. Hummus and Naan were absolutely delicious ğŸ¤¤ the chicken itself on all our platters were sadly tasteless. Still very edible and not deserving of extreme criticism. We left with full bellies.
Thank you for your service and efforts ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸ¤

This restaurant used to be a good place but now it changed.  It's almost empty all day, they lost most of their customers because the food getting bad. When you ask them about certain types of food they tell yes we have it but when they put on the table you find something else

Assalamualaikum..
I would like to share my Dinner options . Its was so so bad . Chef is take my ORDER . My.order was mendi chicken and 2 grilled chicken.chef sent for us mendi chicken . Then his left.. how funny.But we are waiting for grill chicken. After 5 minutes we asked server how long they take time for that. Then they are said no nothing else. I donâ€™t know why they are did the . My daughter is very very upset. . This is so bad guys .. unhappy stupid thinkâ€¦. Please be careful full guys . Thank you have good night..

Wallah this place is sooooo good and beautiful food good service good
More respect for the customer if I come back to ny this place is my restaurant for good
The prices are great, the drinks are excellent, and the customer service is top-notch. Always a pleasant experienceâ€”highly recommended!

The lamb haneeth arrived super tender, perfumed with spices, its fat crisped and caramelized so each bite melted into the fluffy well seasoned rice.  I also had the grilled lamb on pita, which was excellent too. Started things out with their soup, a rich broth that tasted like it simmered for hours and also went great with the rice. Friendly staff and that unbeatable location steps from spots for Adeni chai make Azal an easy favorite.
Iâ€™ve come here many times now and can confidently say that the food is delicious and the service is always amazing.
Nice asead.and.fatah

We went for lunch with excitement cz it was our first time.I ordered Chicken Mendi,,,,we found metal on the food then we called the server. He said,Its nothing. Instead of saying sorry the server said,i's not hair you can eat it!!!! The server even didnâ€™t felt guilty for what he did he was just smiling!!!
Worst Service Ever!!!
Good
Tried the Fahsa , it was big chunks of meat not shredded, the service was excellent.

They scammed us during our visit. When we went to place our order, they told us they had the same item we were asking for. But when the food was served, it was something completely different. The taste, ingredients everything was not what we expected. Even though we pointed it out to them, they kept lying and trying to convince us it was the same. On top of that, they charged a lot of money for it. We felt very disappointed and cheated by their behavior
Nice restaurant, delicious food, quiet place

It was a Sunday evening in Little Yemen, the Bronx still buzzing gently with the spirit of Eid. After a community gathering, our groupâ€”friends from across the Arabian Peninsulaâ€”found our way to Azal Restaurant and Hall. There was something incredibly grounding about walking into a space that felt both familiar and deeply rooted in tradition. It wasnâ€™t just about dinnerâ€”it was about reconnecting with home while being far from it.

The restaurant had a quiet hum to itâ€”families gathered around large tables, laughter rising and falling in the background, and the scent of spiced lamb and bubbling stew drifting from the kitchen. It felt like the kind of place where food isnâ€™t platedâ€”itâ€™s shared. Generous, warm, and unapologetically authentic.

We started with two childhood classicsâ€”Vimto and Shaniâ€”iced and sweet, the kind of drinks that immediately take you back. The food came out family-style: a bubbling fahsa stew in its traditional stone pot, rich with flavor and served with hot Yemeni bread perfect for scooping; haneeth lamb over fragrant rice, fall-off-the-bone tender; and zarabyan rice, layered with spice and slow-cooked lamb, slightly bolder and more aromatic.

The table was completed with fresh salad and a light, warmly spiced soupâ€”a gesture of hospitality we didnâ€™t even need to ask for. Everything felt thoughtful, generous, and made to be shared.

Azal doesnâ€™t try to modernize or reinterpretâ€”it preserves. It serves food like itâ€™s meant to be remembered. For all of us, being from the Arabian Peninsula, this dinner felt like something more than familiar. It felt like home, translated across a few thousand miles.

In a city full of options, Azal Restaurant and Hall stands out by staying true. If youâ€™re seeking a taste of home, or even just the warmth that comes with it, this is a place to sit, eat, and be reminded.
Muhammad was very Nice and respectful! The Food was AMAZINGLY GOOD ğŸ‘ ğŸ‘ I Love the Yemeni Tea too !  We'll be back VERY SOON
Good food . Nice spacious place. I will come again

A few days ago, my friends and I visited Azal Restaurant, and it was a great experience. We ordered the Mix Grill Platter, Lamb Khabsa, and Chicken Biryani â€” and every dish was full of flavor.

The meats in the Mix Grill Platter were incredibly juicy and well-seasoned, grilled to perfection. The Lamb Khabsa had a rich, aromatic flavor with tender meat that practically melted in the mouth. The Chicken Biryani was also a standout â€” fragrant, well-spiced, and generously portioned.

Overall, the food was delicious, and the portions were satisfying. If youâ€™re looking for a spot that serves authentic Middle Eastern flavors with quality meats, Azal is definitely worth checking out.

Best service for Yemeni food in morris park. Free self serve tea, lemonade, and orange juice. Delicious and fresh haneeth. Good complimentary salad and soup.

Wow what can I say I've never seen something like this from any restaurant. I ordered chicken biryani. I saw the order from the see thru cover and thought they must put the chicken at the bottom when I got home I went thru it all and all I got was a chicken neck, couple of bones and potatoes. What a shame. I will be asking for a refund because I didn't ask for Bone biryani. Shame on the person that prepared this plate. It's ramadan and this is what I wanted to break my fast with.
Azad Restaurant & Hall itâ€™s so good foods & good service.Itâ€™s Arabic & Asian foods thatâ€™s why I like this foods.
Nazir Mohsen and yaser service was good
The best restaurant in the world
Reasonable prices and delicious food.
Bronzini fish is a must try!
The food was amazing
Itâ€™s really amazing food ever I had Thankx chef BELAL ğŸ˜˜
Best Food Halal I like Thier Chicken Its delicious and staff is very friendly

food was delicious and served with Family Manner.
thanks a lot from

This is my favorite restaurant in New York .i find here good service and the best Arabic ( halal) food.Price is reasonable .I like this restaurant too much and my family loves to go there. This restaurant it too big and environment is really good. Workers are too friendly . Yes i recommend to go there.
The food was very good. Fast efficient and tasty.
The service is good, , the guys are great, the food is delicious,  and the place is clean and spacious.
Food was very good.

Itâ€™s my regular spot.Love their food.
Itâ€™s amazing.One of the best restaurant in Bronx.
They have the best bread and Fahsa. The lamb mahndi was also really good and the staff was friendly. Highly recommend

I dined in this hall for my first time as it was in the area. The food was out of this world and i will be a regular customer. I loved the fahsa they had and freshly baked bread. The service was one of the best. I reccomend this spot to any Yemeni food first timers.

Just the right place to experience Halal kababs and Arabian dishes. The staff is super friendly and would take a step ahead to suggest you the best thing on the menu.

They have small cabins so that you can enjoy with your family in privacy. They give a fresh new white tracing paper over the table which they ensures hygiene at its best. The food comes in really quick once ordered. The soup served as the welcome item is very flavourful and sets your taste buds in the tone for some delicious foods on the way.

I didn't like their desserts though.

This evening, we dined at Azal Restaurant, a remarkable spot in the Bronxâ€™s Little Yemen neighborhood. Having never experienced Yemeni cuisine before, we were pleasantly surprised by the rich flavors and, above all, the exceptional hospitality we encountered at this hidden gem. The food was authentically prepared and incredibly tasty, and the servers were wonderfully attentive. Despite being the only patrons not from Yemen, we felt completely at home. The staff graciously offered us samples from the menu to help us make informed choices, ensuring we enjoyed our meal. Even my daughter, who is a picky eater, relished everything she tried, much to our delight. The prices were reasonable, and the ambiance was genuinely authentic. We were also pleasantly surprised by the generous portions we received. We will definitely be returning to Azal and highly recommend it to others seeking an authentic Yemeni dining experience.

Delicious food, bread with sesame was fantastic. Very quick service. Clean restaurant. I'm very happy with my visit. Also, I don't speak Arabic, and I didn't have any problems. Negative reviews are misleading and absolutely not representative, feel more like trolls or competitors

This place is really great ğŸ‘. We visited after the jumma prayer around 3 pm. We started with French fries and falafel. We wanted to order a grape leaves platter but it was not available.

Our main dish was lamb haneeth, shrimp sandwich, charcoal grilled Chicken, Chicken Tawook, khabsa lamb, Salmon. We finished with tea and Fanta drinks.

The food is great. The best one is lamb haneeth. Please don't forget to try it.

In the corner there is a prayer place. Also there are three tables on the right hand side where you can sit with your family privately.

Service is very good ğŸ˜Š. They put the tablecloths and help you settle down. They are very polite and helpful.

There are some slight differences between the menu in the website of the restaurant and the actual physical menu that we received in the restaurant.

Please see the pictures for the most updated menu as of July 2024.
Tasty & Delicious food. Mouth watering tender Kebabs ; flavorful long grain Basmati rice. Staff is friendly & caring.

Great food. Loved it. One of the best Yemenis place in the neighborhood. Would definitely be coming here again with the wife! My friends and I were so hunger and food was so delicious and hot that I burned the top of my mouth. Oops

First time I ever had Yemeni food, and it was delicious. Giant servings at nice prices. The atmosphere is nice, too, with marble tables, and wooden arches all over the walls and ceilings. The Adeni lemonade and Adeni tea are must try!

As a fellow Yemeni, I am very disappointed. After Friday prayers we usually have a family dinner, and this time I chose this place. I ordered a few things.
Bread: very rubbery and burnt on the edges.
Fasoolia Yemeni (kidney beans):  tastes good but a little too spicy.
Fahsah Shrimp: tastes good but too spicy.
Grape Leaves Platter: the menu says its with ground beef, I was excited for it since itâ€™s a rarity.. but wait there was no meat in the grape leaves.
Glabah Chicken: this was alright but nothing special.
Kebsah Lamb: alright, nothing special
Bent Alsahan (traditional bread with black seeds and honey): this tasted pretty good and honestly should be served as the bread instead of what ever rubber we were given.
$124 for this? Ø­Ø±Ø§Ù… Ø¹Ù„ÙŠÙƒÙ… .. money aside it was embarrassing serving this to my family. Lastly, the service needs improvement with an understanding of how many servings is each plate.
I ordered 1/2 Chicken Mandi and was satisfied with the flavor. The chicken skin is just a bit salty and would be nice if the tomato salsa is more. Also, soup is great to include.

Menu VS Real Foodâ€¦
Choice is yours!!!!

Ordered shish kabab..menu says it will come with beef meat. They made the platter with leftover chicken and beef meat. No onion no peppers. Some old fries on top. As you can find in the picture.
And service? Outstanding horrible!!!
You will never forget in your life.
But their PEPSI can was so testy.

I promised myself that I will write a review for those Yemeni restaurants that opened next to each other in the same neighbourhood and decide what will be my favourite one.

Here is my experience with this new restaurant:

1) Parking: I had a hard time find a parking. I finally got one on the street where I had to pay $1.75 for 80 minutes.

2) Restaurant atmosphere and cleanliness: this restaurant is very clean and brings a cultural presence that takes an insight into the old city of Sanna. I felt I was in Yemen. Well done!

3) Greeting and seating: when I entered the restaurant, no one greeted me or helped me finding a seat. The owner should elevate the customer service by hiring at least two people. The waiter was taking orders, cleaning, helping existed customers, and getting the food from the kitchen, poor waiter. I then got a menu and found myself a seat. After 3-4 minutes, the waiter showed up and I waived my hand to let him know that I am ready to order. The waiter was very polite and helpful and helped me select a dish.

4) The menu: it is well presented and easy to follow. I visited the restaurant during breakfast. Thus, I ordered Sackshuka, Yemeni bread, and Adni tea. The food was perfect and reminded me of Momâ€™s cooking style. Well done.

5) The food took a while to get onto my table, but they seemed short staffed. Therefore, I wonâ€™t use this factor in my reviewing process

6) Bill: I paid less than $13 which totally worth the money and the wait.

Hopefully, I will try their lunch when I am in town.

I will give this restaurant 5/5 for their breakfast menu.
Staff was so friendly, cheap prices, and very authentic and tasty, 10/10 recommend!
Had a lunch here loved the food amazing taste and good Arabian cuisine best try chicken Mandi Will visit again
Obviously very popular and great for events. InshaAllah we will try to soon. Great to see new restaurants popping up in the area.

Went with family to try a new cuisine. Did not disappoint. Ordered the family platter and it was a generous portion of beef, lamb, chicken, rice and bread. We're already planning on coming back in a few weeks. Don't be intimidated if you're unfamiliar with the dishes. The waiter and chef are more than willing to make recommendations and explain the items in the menu.

Extremely disappointing experience. We ordered specific dishes, but they served us completely different food without any explanation. When we confronted them, they casually mentioned that they didnâ€™t have what we ordered, yet they didnâ€™t bother to inform us beforehand. It felt as though they didnâ€™t want foreigners in their establishment. To make matters worse, the prices listed on the menu didnâ€™t match what we were charged at checkout. This kind of dishonesty is unacceptable. May Allah guide them to be more honest and transparent in their dealings.

Took my family to try Yemeni dish. Brother Mohammed recommended mix platter. Great food. Kebabs are tender and juicy. Great portion size. Great customer service. Brother Mohammed is best and the sister is great. Highly recommended.
Food was very good! They need to improve their service overall it was good ğŸ‘

I stopped by with my brother for breakfast. Today as we traveled from a different state. And we enjoyed the food quality and service. Everything about the atmosphere was good. Other customers were just loud. But overall recommend it for Yemeni authentic food and the service is very welcoming.

This spot will have a special place in my heart. We were welcomed with open arms and big smiles. The service was quick because it is Ramadan. The food was delicious with robust flavors and a sweet aroma. I appreciate the dedicated employees to help with breaking the fast for many Muslims tonight! Allahuma Barik ğŸ¤²ğŸ¾â¤ï¸
Iâ€™m fan Excellent service excellent quality food and beautiful environment. Friendly and welcoming service we were greeted with warm tea just excellent hospitality touch
Their food quality is very bad. Itâ€™s not worth it to go there.
Nice and clean restaurant, quick and friendly service. Food was really good. I recommend this restaurant. Oh, if you are driving there, parking could be a issue.

I had a DELICIOUS soup here this afternoon. Highly recommended!

Service not great. The servers don't provide a menu and speak rudely. The food came very quick, which was a surprise to me because some of their menu options should be taking longer to cook. I received a lamb dish in 5 minutes. All their food has no flavor. The lamb was tender but tasted like nothing. Their food is edible, but not good in any way.

Good evening, the service was bad, and the person holding the cashier was very bad and did not treat me kindly. I entered the restaurant and waited for approximately 35 minutes for my order and I was not served in the desired manner. There were people who entered the restaurant 15 minutes after I entered and were served and offered hospitality while I waited for 35 minutes. I was not looked at and served, and there is tribal fanaticism on the part of the service providers in the restaurant. The rating is bad and I will not repeat the visit.
Very friendly and generous, give you free salad soup and tea. Delicious foodâ€”especially the hummus with lamb. Canâ€™t stop coming back here!

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. Despite a waiter's recommendation, the food was terrible. When we raised the issue, the waiter ignored us and became rude. Additionally, there was a discrepancy in the pricing â€“ we were charged more than what was initially quoted. Overall, a regrettable visit, and I won't be returning.
